channel.title: [PI]Adding a simple timer to a command
channel.description:
This is just a very simple tutorial on how to add a timer to a command, so a player can only use each command once every X Milliseconds.
First, for the command,
[code=Java] if (playerCommand.startsWith("command")) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastCommand > 30000) { //If the lastCommand timer is greater than 30,000 milliseconds (30 Seconds) c.lastCommand = System.currentTimeMillis(); //Resets the lastCommand timer c.sendMessage("You may use this command once every 30 seconds."); //Sends a message
} else { //If the lastCommand timer is not greater than 30,000 Milliseconds c.sendMessage("Sorry, But you must wait 30 seconds before using this command again!");//Sends a message } }[/code]
Next in Player.java Find [code=Java]public long lastPlayerMove[/code] And add the name of your timer, in this case it would be lastCommand so we would change the end of this integer from [code=Java], foodDelay, potDelay;[/code] To [code=Java], foodDelay, potDelay, lastCommand;[/code] Or we can add it in between [code=Java], foodDelay, lastCommand, potDelay;[/code] Where you add it doesn't matter, Just make sure that at the end of the integer there is a ;
This is a very simple tutorial but I couldn't find any other tutorials on how to do this and I figured it out by taking an already made command and playing around with it a bit.
This can be useful for limiting commands, in particular the "yell" command which is often abused.
And no, I don't make tutorials so please don't flame if it's not good, But i do like constructive criticism, as long as it's not flame.
